com.samsung.fastcast.statemachine

Class StateMachine<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.fastcast.statemachine.StateMachine<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - Enumerator with all possible states
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    StateChanger<S>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CastManager

    public class StateMachine<S>
extends java.lang.Object
implements StateChanger<S>
    Simple state machine implementation. It is always in some state. It can change state from one to another and will invoke state change event which will be dispatched to all listeners
    Author:
    t.gdala

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      StateChangeDispatcher<S> onStateEnds
      Dispatcher for leaving state events.
      StateChangeDispatcher<S> onStateStarts
      Dispatcher for entering state events.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • onStateEnds

        public StateChangeDispatcher<S> onStateEnds
        Dispatcher for leaving state events. You can add your listener to it to get known about state leaving events.

      • onStateStarts

        public StateChangeDispatcher<S> onStateStarts
        Dispatcher for entering state events. You can add your listener to it to get known about state enter events.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StateMachine

        public StateMachine(S default_state)
        StateMachine constructor. Makes StateMachine object and sets it default state as current.
        Parameters:
        default_state - default state of this machine.

    • Method Detail

      • gotoState

        public void gotoState(S state,
                      java.lang.Object data)
        Implementation of gotoStates method. It changes state and invokes dispatchers when leaving old state and entering new state
        Specified by:
        gotoState in interface StateChanger<S>
        Parameters:
        state - new state
        data - data associated with state change. It can be null if there are no data.
        See Also:
        StateChanger.gotoState(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

      • getCurrentState

        public S getCurrentState()
        Current state getter
        Returns:
        Current state of this state machine

      • setDefaultState

        public void setDefaultState()
        Default state setter. It sets default states of this state machine. Default state is the starting state.
